page.title: 18Memories of Hook
page.content: {Mr.Belton}has lived in{Hook}for{80 years and his wife has lived in the village for{79}years. During that time they have seen many changes.There used to be{five farms}and a number of cottages where the farm workers lived. Now there are many new{housing estates and the farms employ few men.There used to be{five shops}including{the {post office, a butcher's and the {grocery store.}Now there are only two, {the newsagent and the post-office.} Some of the shops sold paraffin because there was no electric light.At the end of the village there was a {ferry}which crossed the river to {Skelton.}It cost{1d for children}and{ {4d for adults.}There used to be{three {public houses}but now there are{two, {the Sotheron Arms}and the{Blacksmith's {Arms.}The{Sotheron Arms}is named after the well known{Sotheron}family.
